caption.p: The antiviral activities of polyphenols, some examples from the available studies.

tr.td: Theaflavins inhibited the Sindbis Virus infection by 99% at a concentration of 14.6mM.
Act directly on HCV-viral particles and inhibit the ability to bind to the receptor surface.
EGCG effectively inhibits porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus infection and replication in porcine alveolar macrophages. It prevents MARC-145 cells.
EGCG directly interacts with the Dengue virus molecule causing virus deformation and thus preventing the virus from infecting further cells.
Radix Sophorae, rhrizome Acanthopanacis, radix Sanguisorbae and extract Torilis fructus
Inhibits the effects on replication stages and/or their influence on cellular signal pathways of Mouse hepatitis virus.
Inhibitory effects on the ATPase of mouse hepatitis and DENV type 2 virus.
Inhibiting effect on transmissible gastroenteritis virus proliferation in vitro and associated with its anti-oxidation.
Inhibition of the replication of HCoV NL63 in a cell-type independent manner.
Inhibition of avian infectious bronchitis virus replication
Resveratrol inhibits the binding of Zika virus particles to cells and reduces circulating Zika virus particles, which underlines its potential of limiting disease severity during the viraemic phase.

Resveratrol exhibited potent inhibitory effects against influenza in MDCK cells via the blockade of nuclear-cytoplasmic translocation of viral ribonucleoprotein complexes, the decrease in the expression of late viral proteins, and the inhibition of cellular protein kinase C activity and its dependent pathways.
Several blueberry varieties exert anti-influenza viral activities, especially viral adsorption, which positively correlated with the total polyphenol content in Madin-Darby canine kidney cells.
